content: Not a bad game, but a lot of the mini puzzles are too hard.

I love the game. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there's a glitch. When the characters are talking, there is no sound and I can see their mouths moving and then the sound will turn on and you can hear them speak. But it does skip every other sentence they say. Thankfully they have subtitles. Developers, if you fix this I will change it to 5 stars!
I wanted to like this game. I noticed right away the voiceovers were off. Im one of those people that would focus on it & it would just make me nuts. I wouldnt be able to enjoy it.
I am loving this game so far but I just started! If it stays this way it's def worth the time to try
I don't like this game it just seems really annoying to me. With the things you have to do and the voices cut out while the characters are talking.

Eh, it was alright. One puzzle in particular where you're measuring liquids, you can't see the recipe at all cause it's so small and you can't pick it up either. The puzzles were so-so, storyline was ok, length was alright and the bonus game was extremely short. Characters voices kept cutting out too. Wasn't too impressed with this one and actually for an AM game, it's rather disappointing.
Spiritual and magic
Terrible voiceovers, horrible storyline.
I loved this game so much. The puzzles were challenging, the graphics were great, and I loved the storyline. 4 stars for the broken mini game - I couldn't move the cheese from my inventory
Love the game.. But could not finish bonus level it would not let me claim the last yarn so couldn't go forward...! Very disappointing!! Please..

The main game was ok. Graphics we're not very good. Bonus level is broken and can't be completed.

I'd stop playing for an hour, turn back on, could add the item from inventory, only to run into the glitch 3 more times.
Fun, but would like it longer
This was fun ty
It was easy to navigate. It took me awhile to figure out how to do the mini games. Interesting story. Fun to do.

-1 star because the voices where taking a walk in the dialogues . -1 star cause the yarn was missing in the bonus level so there was no way to keep playing . -1 star for the repeating spam to rate you ( how about that ratting ?:) ) and the movement . +1 star for nice jolly graphics ( owful character movement but hey i will let this one go ) . +1 star for the magical assintant ( that was original i dare to say ) and the story ( was cute ) . Great game!

Could be better could be worse. Bonus chapter is short and has a bug. For some reason when there's cut scenes only every other sentence is said out loud. Besides that it's pretty good.

This game wanted to be a hidden picture story instead of a point and click puzzle game. So many hidden pictures, even for progression things like a bucket of water are hidden in a picture instead of a puzzle. The active zones aren't really marked well either. The one thing this game did well was story, I felt pretty invested and enjoyed all of the diverse areas.

Good

I was having fun until I got to the bonus content. This isn't this developer's best game, but the unplayable bonus content ruined the entire experience for me.
Pretty good game. A few of the spots you have to tap are a little too small. The nonogram puzzle in the bonus story is literally unsolvable without outright guessing.
Nice game
this game is very fun even though i have to use the hint button quite a bit ! it has alot of puzzles adventure and hidden objects.

Ok I have several issues with this game: 1) game is good but the puzzles are really freaking hard and take away from the solve and hidden objects. Didnt need puzzle after puzzle. 2) Dark Isle or whatever it is, the little red figure you called a babushka is actually a matroishka... Get it right or correct it. Do your freaking research. I couldnt find the stupid matroishka because babushka is Russian for grandma. 3) the voice acting cuts out. Finish a scene. Dialog feels unfinished.

The game itself was quite short, as was the bonus chapter. Some mini-games were fun, especially the one in the bonus chaper where one action triggers another.
I quite enjoyed the game - nice story line, great graphics  and  mini-games. However its too short
Love it

Ok game. Story a bit twee. Lots of HOPs, most of which are easy, although some items v hard to make out.
Very good. It would be even better if it was longer.

When i'm playing bonus round I just found the magnifying glass at search for the yarns ... I can't get the last yarn because it wasn't there at the carpet even though I used hint ... please fix that ..
Great!

Seems like a game whose designer left before finishing the project. (If you're a student, this is a great example of why you don't turn in first drafts.) Not at all what you'd expect from AM. Very short gameplay; story is thin and the characters in no way compelling; the puzzles do not mesh with the story nor, frankly, do the various areas of the story link coherently with one another. Puzzles are as standard for the genre and there are rather a lot of puzzles compared to other games (or it appears so; I didn't count, it may well be the threadbare story and short gameplay making the puzzles more frequent though not more numerous). Game mechanics such as the helper fairy and magnifier are unexplained when they become available (although they're pretty big standard, you'll know it if you've used similar bits before) and the fairy has tediously long animations.
Too Short! Disappointing compared to their other games. Thank goodness I only paid the sale price.
Very short game. Bonus ridiculously short. Not really worth even the sale price, worst AF game I have played yet.
A bit short. Not as good as other AM games.

I'm a person who really loves classic fantasy type games, so I may be a bit biased, but I think this is a great game. So far, good plot and excellent HOGs. There are a ton of mini games & puzzles so I'm OK with the fact that some are over quickly. Like all such games, you have to suspend your disbelief a bit (elaborate puzzle lock for a box containing a cart handle... Really?) but it's well worth it. If the game ends up to be a bit too short, I'm fine with it! Edit: I changed to 4 stars because it seemed they really didn't put much thought into the end of the game. The plot lost all its thrust. Also, there is a glitch in the bonus game with yarn balls and I cannot complete the quest.
Puzzles games all very poorly explained and game was very short with a disappointing story line
Incomprehensible logic especially in the add element scenes....not up to usual standard. Shame.
Not bad. It's just kind of short even with the bonus game. In fact, the bonus game took not even 15 minutes. And there wasn't a lot of challenging puzzles. Instructions for mini games were lacking.

The storyline is shallow. You're the queen but you must find things for upset subjects before they give you what you need. You're the queen but they won't open the gate because they have "orders" not to. A couple HO items have you shaking your head. For example; I've never seen a math compass called a "divider tool." Just not very developed.
I just didnt like it so
Very good story with challenging puzzles. Lots of fun.

For a new game by this company it doesn't enjoy some of the smoother action that other titles do. The mini games and their descriptions are awful. The story itself doesn't seem well thought out. Together, this game is truly disappointing and I am hesitant about whether to complete it. Sigh...better luck next time.

The storyline has virtually nothing to do with the game play, so if the story is important to you, you probably won't like this game.  However, it has a wide variety of nonstop puzzles in multiple levels of difficulty, and once I forgot about the story I enjoyed it very much.
Queens qiest
It is ok not one of my favorites
The game wad good but giving it one star because I play all of AMs game and it really makes me mad that they only offer me 30 percent off games I've already played. Kinda a bummer.
Not one of the best. Still I  played all the way through.

Liked the main game, but it did seem much shorter than others. I did have trouble with locating the last ball of yarn in the bonus game. Once I did find it, I couldn't get past collecting the cheese. Once I had that, I was unable to use it or even select it in my inventory.

This gets very mixed reviews on Steam, but i can't justify all the poor ones. Keeping in mind that HOPA protagonists are _necessarily_ OCD, _most_ of this game is well done. There is at least one puzzle which make absolutely no sense (the instructions differ wildly from the solution in the "knights and dragons" puzzle in the courtyard), or seem oddly weird (e.g. what happens when you assemble the clock behind the clockwork dragon), but by and large well done. The HO scenes are notably simpler than in most HOPAs i've played (less "noise", so the items are easier to spot), a few have ambiguous terms (e.g., "bow" when the HO scene has both a ribbon/bow and a violin bow). Story is cheesy, voice-overs are mostly decent, graphics are typical (good) Artifex quality, music is unmemorable but not annoying. Take the protagonist's quirks with a grain of salt, and you'll likely enjoy it. If you take her (and her insubordinate subjects) too seriously, you won't enjoy it at all.
So far so good. Just finished. Was good game. Enjoyed HOP with morphing objects and has map which always helps. Bonus game very short though.
